attributes.action: Stop Mark Drakeford introducing 20 mph limits in 30 mph zones.
attributes.additional_details: Labour aren’t the governing party in power at this time, don’t forget the £32 million he is going to waste at the taxpayers expense.
attributes.background:
Parliament has the power to introduce new laws, this should be a decision concerning the whole of the uk, not the Welsh assembly. 
£32 million could be better spent on other things.
This is going to cause friction between drivers and other road users.
This is not a decision for Labour.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Welsh Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.  

The Welsh Parliament has its own Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Welsh Parliament, you can find out more here:

https://petitions.senedd.wales/

You can find out more about devolution in Wales here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/cbp-8318/
